snippet: The United States will greatly accelerate its handover of detainees to Afghan control, but retain a veto over who can be released.
abstract: United States agrees to greatly accelerate its transfer of imprisoned insurgents to Afghan government control, but will retain a veto over which ones can be released; compromise is effort to break impasse on a broader strategic partnership; Americans hope to ensure that Afghan government can hold out against the Taliban and that Al Qaeda cannot re-establish a stronghold.
lead_paragraph: The United States will greatly accelerate its handover of detainees to Afghan control, but retain a veto over who can be released.

headline.seo: U.S. and Afghanistan Agree on Detainee Transfer
headline.main: U.S. and Afghanistan Agree on Prisoner Transfer as Part of Long-Term Agreement
headline.print_headline: U.S. and Afghanistan Agree on Prisoner Transfer as Part of Long-Term Agreement

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
